document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of digenean parasites of amphibians and reptiles from Argentina

bibRefCitation.author: Travassos
bibRefCitation.refString: Travassos, L. (1927) Nouvelle espece de Trematodes. Comptes rendus des s e ances de la Soci e t e de Biologie, 97, 1080 - 1081.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Host and records:
Hydrodynastes gigas (Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854 )
(ER, C, Ch , BA) Site of infection: mouth, lung.

References: Caubisens Poumarou ( 1968 ),
Lunaschi & Sutton ( 1985 )
,
Martínez et al. ( 1996 )
. Comments:
Travassos ( 1927
, 1928 ) used two very similar generic names: Glassidiella and Glossidiella. Caubisens Poumarou and Lunaschi & Sutton consider that the generic name is Glassidiella. On the basis of this common usage and stability, this name is also retained here, although according to the law of priority the Glassidiella
Travassos, 1927
should theoretically be re-established.

Host and records:
Hydrodynastes gigas (Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854 )
(BA, ER, C, Ch ). Site of infection: trachea, lung.

References: Caubisens Poumarou ( 1968 ),
Lunaschi & Sutton ( 1985 )
,
Martínez et al. ( 1996 )
.

Host and record:
Micrurus frontalis (Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854 )
(M).

Hosts and records:
Mastigodryas bifossatus triseriatus (Amaral, 1931 ) ( Ch )
,
Liophis guentheri Peracca 1897
(M),
Philodryas psammophideus Günther, 1872 (Cba, F)
,
Lystropis dorbignyi Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854
,
Thamnodynastes
sp. (cited as
T. pallidus
) (M, C),
Bothrops jararaca (Wied, 1824 )
(unknown).

Comments:
T. pallidus
was incorrectly cited since this species has never been reported in Argentina .

Hosts and records:
Liophis miliaris semiaureus (Cope, 1862 )
(BA),
Waglerophis merremi (Wagler 1824 )
(M).

References:
Boero et al . ( 1972 )
,
Lunaschi & Drago ( 2001 )
.

Host and record:
Waglerophis merremi (Wagler 1824 )
(M). Site of infection: intestine.

Hosts and records:
Mastigodryas bifossatus triseriatus (Amaral, 1931 )
(M, C),
Liophis guentheri Peracca 1897 ( Ch )
,
Waglerophis merremi (Wagler 1824 )
(Cba, ER, SF, Ch , C),
Lystropis dorbignyi Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854
(SE, C, SF),
Boiruna maculata (Boulenger, 1896 )
(S),
Bothrops alternatus Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854
( Ch , SF, BA, C),
B. neuwiedi diporus Cope 1862 ( Ch )
,
B. jararaca (Wied, 1824 )
(M),
B. moojeni Hoge, 1966 ( Ch )
,
Helicops infrataeniatus Jan, 1865
(C),
H. leopardinus (Schlegel, 1837 )
(C),
Hydrodynastes gigas (Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854 )
(ER, C, Ch ),
Philodryas patagoniensis (Girard, 1857 )
(T),
Thamnodynastes strigatus (Günther, 1858 )
(C, M., Ch ),
Thamnodynastes
sp. (C),
Liophis anomalus (Günther 1858 ) (Cba)
,
Liophis flavifrenatus (Cope 1862 )
(M),
Micrurus pyrrhocryptus (Cope 1862 ) ( Ch , F)
.

Site of infection: mouth, esophagus, stomach, lung and eye. References: Caubisens Poumarou ( 1968 ),
Boero & Led ( 1971 )
,
Martínez et al . ( 1996 )
.

Hosts and records:
Liophis jaegeri (Günther, 1858 )
(BA),
Waglerophis merremi (Wagler 1824 )
(M).

bibRefCitation.author: Lunaschi
bibRefCitation.refString: Lunaschi, L. I. & Drago, F. (2001) Digeneos opistogonimidos parasitos de Waglerophis merremii (Reptilia) de Argentina, con descripcion de Opisthogonimus misionesensis sp. nov. Physis, 58, 31 - 37.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hosts and records:
Eunectes notaeus Cope, 1862
(F),
Waglerophis merremi (Wagler 1824 )
( Ch , Cba, ER, S, C),
Lystrophis dorbignyi Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854
(SF, ER, C),
Hydrodynastes gigas (Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854 )
(C, Ch ),
Leptodeira annulata pulchriceps Duellman, 1958
(unknown),
Thamnodynastes
sp. (cited as
T. pallidus
) (C),
Philodryas patagoniensis (Girard, 1857 )
(T),
Oxyrhopus rhombifer Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854
(C),
Mastigodryas bifossatus triseriatus (Amaral, 1931 )
(C),
Micrurus pyrrhocryptus (Cope 1862 )
(SF, Ch , F),
Bothrops alternatus Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854
(SF, Cba, C),
B. neuwiedi diporus Cope 1862
(unknown),
Tupinambis rufescens (Günther, 1871 )
(S). Site of infection: kidney, ureter, intestine.

References: Caubisens Poumarou ( 1968 ),
Boero et al. ( 1972 )
,
Lunaschi & Sutton ( 1985 )
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Host and records:
Hydrodynastes gigas (Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854 )
(C, Ch , BA). Site of infection: esophagus, lung.

References: Caubisens Poumarou ( 1968 ),
Lunaschi & Sutton ( 1985 )
,
Martínez et al . ( 1996 )
.

Hosts and records:
Waglerophis merremi (Wagler 1824 )
(Cba, M, ER, C, SF, Ch ),
Lystrophis dorbignyi Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854
(ER, SF),
Sibynomorphus ventrimaculatus (Boulenger 1885 )
(M),
Thamnodynastes
sp.(C),
Liophis flavifrenatus (Cope 1862 )
(M),
L. miliaris semiaureus (Cope, 1862 )
(BA),
L. jaegeri (Günther, 1858 )
(BA),
Clelia rustica (Cope, 1878 )
(BA),
Philodryas patagoniensis (Girard, 1857 )
(BA),
Bothrops alternatus Duméril, Bibron & Duméril, 1854
(C, Ch , Cba, SF, SE),
B neuwedii diporus Cope 1862
(T, Ch , LR, SL, C),
Liophis poecilogyrus (Wied, 1825 )
(BA).
Site of infection: esophagus, large intestine

Life cycle: Hi 1 :
Pomacea canaliculata (Lamarck)
from Lujan River, Buenos Aires Province. Hi 2 : tadpoles (experimental host, metacercariae in skin) and
Hypsiboas pulchellus (Duméril & Bibron)
(natural host metacercariae in internal organs).
Material deposited: MLP 1101 C, 1137 C, 1142 C.

References: Caubisens Poumarou ( 1968 ),
Boero et al. ( 1972 )
, Ostrowski de Núñez ( 1979 b),
Lunaschi & Sutton ( 1985 )
,
Martínez et al. ( 1996 )
.

Host and record:
Helicops infrataeniatus Jan, 1865
(BA). Site of infection: mouth.
